text: Prince François of Monaco, Count of Thorigny (François Charles; 4 February 1726 – 9 December 1743) was a Monégasque prince and member of the House of Grimaldi. He was known by his title Count of Thorigny.Also spelt as "Torigni" ==Life== Born in Paris. Born at the "Hôtel Matignon" in Paris,His father's townhouse in Paris he was the eighth child of the reigning Princess Louise Hippolyte of Monaco and her husband Prince Jacques I. His father was the Count of ThorignyThrough his mother's side but the title was given to François. His older brother Honoré III would later become the next Prince of Monacao when their father died in 1751. He died unmarried and childless. ==References== Category:1726 births Category:1743 deaths Category:Earls and countesses Category:House of Grimaldi
title: Prince François, Count of Thorigny
